title: Vintage Sheet Music
content:
Greetings! I'm wondering what might come close to the words "Joyeuseté" and "Ravelet".

Any suggestion would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks team!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sheet music.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/typophile.com/files/sheet%20music.jpg) | 36.46 KB |
author: malbright

comments.content:
It's French. No surprise that JOYEUSETÉ is a Didot.  
Consider: Fashion Didot

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FashonDidotAsJOY_5857.png)
  [http://www.linotype.com/424499/fashiondidotregular-font.html?SiteId=574](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.linotype.com/424499/fashiondidotregular-font.html?SiteId=574 "http://www.linotype.com/424499/fashiondidotregular-font.html?SiteId=574") Bordeaux Roman  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BordeauxRomanAsJOY_6205.png)
  [http://www.linotype.com/165256/bordeauxroman-font.html?SiteId=574](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.linotype.com/165256/bordeauxroman-font.html?SiteId=574 "http://www.linotype.com/165256/bordeauxroman-font.html?SiteId=574")  
Not quite as close, but an alternative: Spire 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SpireAsJoy_4266.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/")  
Don

Resurrecting your old request only - [http://typophile.com/node/105415](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/typophile.com/node/105415 "http://typophile.com/node/105415")  
Former suggestions for 'JOYEUSETE': [Bordeaux](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/bordeaux-roman), [Torino Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/torino/condensed), [Onyx](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/onyx), [Bodoni Poster Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.fonts.com/font/adobe/bodoni-poster/compressed), [Fashion Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/fashion-didot), [Moderno FB](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.fontbureau.com/newspaper/fonts/ModernoFB), [Arsis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/arsis), [Ambroise](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/typofonderie.com/fonts/ambroise-family) François, Ian Party's [GRAZIA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/swisstypefaces.com/type-services/exclusive-typefaces/grazia) and [L'OFFICIEL](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/swisstypefaces.com/type-services/exclusive-typefaces/officiel-paris) (with Maxime Buechi), [Stiletto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.stephaneelbaz.com/) bespoke typeface for Stiletto magazine by Stéphane Elbaz  
Relay also Don's previous comment on 'RAVELET', the 2 /E look slightly different so possibly hand-done...

Thanks Ryuk, for mentioning my previous comment on the lettering on the sheet music cover being hand done. I should have repeated my observation that everything on the cover is lithographed or engraved.  
None of the fonts mentioned are an exact match and most are much too wide, except for Spire and possibly Bordeaux.  
If anyone wants to compare the sheet music cover to Ian Party's Grazia and L'Officiel, note that the links mentioned no longer work, but a specimen of Grazia can be seen at [http://typecache.com/Ian\_Party/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/typecache.com/Ian_Party/ "http://typecache.com/Ian\_Party/") The website [http://www.ianparty.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073422/http:/www.ianparty.com/ "http://www.ianparty.com/") is not currently available.  
Don

You guys are amazing. You have my utmost respect.

Thank you so much!

Ryuk—sorry for the double posting!! Thank you for remembering and your kind post.
